info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 12 at 8:52PM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...Illinois...
Mississippi River at Clarksville.
Mississippi River at Louisiana.
River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississippi River at Clarksville.
* WHEN...From Sunday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, State Route P east of Elsberry begins flooding just east of the levee.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 26.0 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall early Thursday morning. It will rise to 26.1 feet Friday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/lsx

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
